subject: Real Estate
title: Historic Preservation Limits
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Historic Preservation Limits.

hook.text: You buy a charming 1920s brownstone. You want to add a rooftop deck. The city says absolutely not.

buildup.text: Historic preservation laws restrict alterations to buildings and districts deemed historically significant.

discovery.text: Changes to facades, windows, rooflines, and materials must be approved by a preservation commission.

twist.text: Owners sometimes benefit â€” historic tax credits can offset 20â€“25% of rehabilitation costs.

climax.text: Preservation protects character but constrains supply. You can't tear down a landmark to build apartments.

punchline.text: History is preserved. The owner's freedom isn't.

quiz.question: What do historic preservation laws restrict?
